plan: To maximize long-term profit, I'll start by bidding my exact value, as it's the dominant strategy. I'll gather data by occasionally bidding slightly below or above my value to gauge opponents' behavior and adjust accordingly. In early rounds, I'll experiment with aggressive bids when my value is high and conservative bids when low. I'll also test bidding just above the second-highest bid from previous rounds to capture potential gains. By analyzing competitors' patterns, I'll refine my strategy to balance risk and reward, aiming to win more often without overpaying.

To maximize long-term profit, I will start by bidding my value to establish a baseline. Next, I'll experiment with slightly higher bids to test if competitors consistently bid below their value, which could increase my winning chances without sacrificing profit. I'll also try aggressive bids close to the maximum in low-value rounds to gather data on opponent behavior. Observing patterns, such as frequent underbidding or risk-averse behavior, will guide adjustments. I'll adapt dynamically, using the gathered insights to refine my strategy, balancing risk and reward to optimize overall earnings across all rounds.

To maximize long-term profit, I'll initially test the dominant strategy by bidding my exact value to establish a baseline. Next, I'll explore aggressive overbidding slightly above my value to test if opponents are conservative, potentially securing wins with marginal losses. I'll also try underbidding slightly to gauge opponents' aggression and reduce potential losses. By alternating these strategies and analyzing opponents' patterns, I'll adjust my bids dynamically. I'll prioritize learning opponents' tendencies early, then adapt to maximize profits in later rounds. This approach balances risk and data-gathering to optimize long-term earnings.

Analyze competitors' patterns to refine strategy, balancing risk and reward to win more without overpaying. Adjust based on observed outcomes.
